questions.question: Where can medical recovery services be obtained, such as in hospitals or sanatoriums?
Are medical recovery services available for both children and adults?
What is the maximum duration for medical recovery services provided in spa sanatoriums annually?
Can the annual duration of medical recovery services in spa sanatoriums be divided into multiple periods?
What is the minimum number of procedures per day for medical recovery in spa sanatoriums?
How many days per week are medical recovery procedures typically provided in spa sanatoriums?
Do patients need to pay a personal contribution for medical recovery services received in spa sanatoriums?
Are there any groups of people exempt from paying a personal contribution for medical recovery services in spa sanatoriums?
Are patients required to fully cover the costs for medical recovery services that extend beyond a standard hospitalization period?
What kind of referral is needed to receive physical medicine and rehabilitation treatment in spa sanatoriums?
Which types of doctors are authorized to issue referrals for physical medicine and rehabilitation treatment in spa sanatoriums?
What specific criteria are used to determine eligibility for a referral for physical medicine and rehabilitation treatment?
Who determines the exact period and flow of medical recovery services for a patient?
Is there a limit to the number of days for medical recovery services provided in sanatoriums that are not spa or preventive sanatoriums?
Where can an official guide on the rights to social health insurance system services be found?
